channel.title: Martin PROKS
channel.description: A minimal hugo theme focus on content

item.description:
ðŸ‘¾ IT

  • MCP for agents to “talk” with your resume? Is this where the job market will move one day? (link)
  • Imagine coding without a screen using AR glasses and peripherals. Although portable, still quite pricey for my taste (link)

ðŸ”¬Science

ðŸ”— Links

  • Nice and clean default settings for macOS (link). Thank you Catalin’s Tech! 
    # Enable tap-to-click for the trackpad
defaults write com.apple.AppleMultitouchTrackpad Clicking -bool true
defaults -currentHost write -g com.apple.mouse.tapBehavior -int 1
# Disable the .DS file creation
defaults write com.apple.desktopservices DSDontWriteNetworkStores -bool true
defaults write com.apple.desktopservices DSDontWriteUSBStores -bool true

ðŸ”§ Tools
item.author: Calvin Tran

item.description:
ðŸ‘¾ IT

  • It’s happening, pylock.toml is supported by pip and uv and are we experiencing a fight for type checkers? (link)
  • Alex showcases how efficiently export and import sqlite #database - awesome hack! (link)
    • $ sqlite3 explorer.db .dump | gzip -c > explorer.db.txt.gz
  • Ibrahim has enough of bots and fights them with a clever zip bomb (link)

ðŸ”¬Science

  • Satirical life journey of a PhD student (link). I wonder how many PhDs can relate to this story ðŸ¤”

ðŸ”— Links

  • Thanks to metagenomics, doctors cured Bristol’s eyesight infection by targeted antibiotics treatment. This showcases we need access to precision medicine (link)
  • FDA approves genetically modified pigs using CRISPR which can be safely eaten. The genetic modification boosts immune system of pigs agains 99% of known PRRS viruses. Would you still eat them knowing this? (link)

ðŸ”§ Tools

  • With dataframely you can specify a validation schema for your polars (link)
item.author: Calvin Tran

item.description:
ðŸ‘¾ IT

  • Easy to follow granular explanation of how DeepSeek was trained by Anita from vellum (link)

ðŸ”¬Science

ðŸ”— Links

  • Another reminder to keep thinking about #privacy (link)
  • Looks like gladiators really fought wild animal based on some interesting discoveries in York (link)
  • Interesting #history lesson on post-war effect of Agent Orange during Vietnam war. The side effects of the agent are associated to developmental disabilities still today (link)
  • tim shows how he used mitmproxy to track the trackers (link)

ðŸ”§ Tools
item.author: Calvin Tran

item.description:
ðŸ‘¾ IT

  • Interesting take on Model Context Protocol (MCP); it’s not about the data, it’s about how the chatbot will integrate with it (link)

ðŸ”¬Science

  • #history Margaret Dayhoff who laid foundations for the field of bioinformatics. (link)
  • CT scans can increase a risk of cancer and therefore should be justified before applying them on patients, but beware of limitations of the study. (link)

ðŸ”— Links

  • SeaCURE tries to remove CO2 from the water to reduce climate change. They do so by converting the sea water more acidic which releases CO2 which is further stored. (link)
  • Latest measurements of toothpaste content reveal high levels of toxic metals way above FDA standard limits. (link)
  • By donating (transplanting) a womb to her younger sister Grace, Grace was able to give birth to a child through in-vitro fertilization (IVF). The womb transplantation was first performed in Sweden in 2014. (link)
  • Personalized humanoids under review (link)

ðŸ”§ Tools
item.author: Calvin Tran

item.description:
ðŸ‘¾ IT

  • Work from Martin Karsten where he focuses on optimizing network processing in Linux which can reduce up to 30% CPU consumption, making this interesting use case for data centers. However best results are only possible for high-traffic scenarios (link).
  • Philip Laine writes about his experience with Microsoft forking his Spegel project as Peerd (link)
  • #python PEP 750 accepts t-string (https://davepeck.org/2025/04/11/pythons-new-t-strings/)

ðŸ”¬Science

  • Scientists show in mice that IL-17 cytokine plays two divergent roles - in amygdala it triggers anxiety but in cortex it promotes social behaviour. The study highlights possible link between immune system and nervous system suggesting possibilities new therapies for neural disorders by affecting modulating immune system (link).

ðŸ”— Links

  • brainstorm.gg is a website for brainstorming some fun ideas

ðŸ”§ Tools

  • nari-labs/dia is a 1.6B model capable of generating ultra-realistic dialogue with open-weights published on Hugging Face
item.author: Calvin Tran
